sentences.english: She looked nettled by my remarks.
sentences.chinese: 看來她被我的話激怒了。

sentences.english: He started another matter to enrage me, but I didn't care.
sentences.chinese: 他又提出另一問題，想以此激怒我，可我並沒在意。

sentences.english: The images of women barefoot on the street, handcuffed and tied to a rope, enraged internet users.
sentences.chinese: 被繩子綁住的婦女赤腳走在街上的畫面激怒了網民。

sentences.english: When riled , the Druids of the Claw display ferocious power and stamina.
sentences.chinese: 當被激怒時，利爪德魯依便展現出兇猛的力量和耐力。

sentences.english: Vernon charges in, stands looking blinded, like an enraged bull.
sentences.chinese: 弗農衝進來站住，兩眼發直，像一頭激怒了的公牛。

sentences.english: So the invasion from an enemy country irritated an Italian scientist.
sentences.chinese: 因此來自一個敵國的入侵激怒了一名意大利的科學家。
約旦政府現在已經被激怒。

sentences.english: His peremptory tone of voice irritated everybody.
sentences.chinese: 他那專橫的語氣激怒了大家。

sentences.english: I'm just here looking for angryanglers.
sentences.chinese: 我來這裏是找“激怒琵琶魚”的。

sentences.english: Sir, in others' eye you are the greatest nuisance. You should not irritate them once more.
sentences.chinese: 同志，你最討人厭了，別再激怒其他人了啊。

sentences.english: South Korea was outraged by the incident.
sentences.chinese: 天安艦事件激怒了整個韓國。

sentences.english: This remark seemed to agitate her guest.
sentences.chinese: 這句話似乎激怒了她的客人。

sentences.english: If provoked, a rhino can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 犀牛被激怒時是很危險的。

sentences.english: I believe that was the first time in my life I was angered by economic injustice.
sentences.chinese: 我相信那是我有生以來首次被如此的經濟不公所激怒。
我的言語顯然激怒了她。

sentences.english: The cheery quality of Ford's voice was beginning to grate on  the barman's  ears.
sentences.chinese: 福特聲音中的愉悅成分激怒了酒吧男侍的耳朵。

definition: to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to flip out/to act out violently
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
